acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.14ppb of  Crustacea (Mysid shrimp) (AQUIRE, 2003).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Category 4 because of "SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LC50(4hr.); VALUE: 3.4mg/L"(ATSDR, 2003)

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Calculated based on the following data: Rat LD50 value: 200mg/kg, 1870mg/kg, 273mg/kg, 796mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001),  and 1030mg/kg (ATSDR, 2003). Since the calculated values was 337.7mg/kg, it was classified to category 4.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and bioaccumulative (log Kow=6.15 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the compounds (expert judgment required because Pyrethrin containing diene structure of the target for the chemical groups with explosive properties present is only a part of a Pyrethrum structure).

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It was considered as Category 2 based on the description that in the oral administration examination during the pregnancy rabbit indicated to ATSDR (2003), although it was unknown about the general toxicity of parent animals, increase in postimplantation loss was observed.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Although ATSDR (2003) and ACGIH (7th, 2001) had descriptions of one case which developed hypersensitivity pneumonitis by inhalation exposure, we could not find other case reports, therefore we presupposed that we could not classify it for the insufficiency of data since it was not concluded that sensitizing property for respiratory organ was positive.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale:
Although only the pyrethrin, which is a part of component, has a grouping relevant to explosiveness, there is no data as a mixture.
[special notes] Although pyrethrin has the diene systems which is the target of the atom group relevant to explosive, this is not the structure applicable to all the composition ingredients of PIRETORAMU. So it requires expert judgment about aforementioned results.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2B based on the description that mild irritation was acknowledged when applied to the eyes of the laboratory animals (ATSDR (2003)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was referred to as Category 3 from description that slight skin irritations were acknowledged in employment evidence of exposure on ATSDR (2003).

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since two or more case reports of contact dermatitis was found in ACGIH (7th, 2001), we classified it as Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, blood, respiratory system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that the effects on the nervous system were observed with the dose a little exceeding the guidance value range of Category 2 in the oral study using the dog (ACGIH (7th, 2001)), and based on the description that the effects on the blood were observed with the dose of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the oral study using the dog (ATSDR (2003)), and based on the description that the effects on the respiratory system was observed with the concentration of the guidance value range of Category 2 in the inhalation exposure test using the rat (ATSDR (2003)), therefore we classified it as Category 2 (nervous systems, blood, respiratory systems).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: From description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) that transient spasm was seen in the child whom oral ingestion was given, and from description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and ATSDR (2003) that the tremor was seen by the oral administration using rats and an inhalation exposure test, it was judged that it had transient effect to the nervous system. So it was set as Category 3 (anesthetic actions).
